ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Anwar Mohiuddin  Excellent and responsive.
Instructor: Anwar Mohiuddin  I interacted with both Anwar and Shuang - both are excellent TA's! Only have great things to say about them!
Instructor: Anwar Mohiuddin  have not interacted with TAs.
Instructor: Hui Li  I never met the TFs and never interacted with them. Maybe it was my fault, but I dont think I ever saw them in the classroom.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Anwar Mohiuddin  Great tutor and a caring human being. He was really concerned about my performance and really helped me understand some of the class' concepts!

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The course covered a wide range of topics. However, each of the topics were covered with enough deepness.
Interesting topics with some relevant news and information - great insights and very helpful powerpoint presentations!
The class syllabus is comprehensive, with a large number of technologies being explored during the class.
Field trips were great, and the lectures covered a side of energy that I am very happy to have learned.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Would be great to integrate a bit of problem solving into the classroom discussion. Also we didn't spend much time on biomass - and I wish we had spent more time on solar...

Teaching engineering concepts using only slideshow is not an effective method. The slides had some animation overwriting some information, and the PDF version provided to the students lacked this info, because it is literary covered by something else. The quality of the explanations also could be improved. Again, the use of slideshow, with the distilled formula is not how one should learn engineering. The method utilized was suitable for seminars, but the exam and problem sets required information often not provided at class or slides.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Maybe we could have solved one or two problems (most challenging ones from HW at the beginning of each class?
N.A.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in renewable energy finance across borders. This course gave me a great fundamental grounding in the science behind the technology and how it affects performance.
I am specializing in clean energy - strategy and finance, so the course was a great overview of complementary areas that I find challenging and exciting.
The course provided background information about renewable energy technologies.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I have worked in the energy industry, but didnt have a physics/engineering background. I wanted to learn more about that side of the energy industry.
Interested in the subject, passionate about curtailing climate change, and looking to work in the space in the future.
To learn more about renewable energy.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, they did
Yes, a great technical overview of the relevant concepts!
No. I was expecting more from the class. Maybe the methodology was not right for me to learn engineering concepts.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Be prepared to be challenged by the problem sets and tests but use the TAs and work together in pairs or small groups to solve Psets.
Great course. I really enjoyed it
Prepare to refresh your high school Physics problem solving skills!
Be prepared to do a lot of online research, given that the class explanations does not meet the requirement for the problem sets.
